definition:
A conjunction is true only when both parameters (called conjuncts) are
true. In English, conjunction is denoted by the word “and”.
Symbolically, we represent it as $\land$ or multiplication applied to
Boolean parameters. Conjunction of $a$ and $b$ would be written
$$a \land b$$ or, in algebraic context, $$a \cdot b$$ or $$ab$$ The
truth table for conjunction is

   $a$   $b$   $a \land b$
  ----- ----- -------------
    F     F         F
    F     T         F
    T     F         F
    T     T         T
